content.raw:
I was using orange because that was decided over a year ago in an internal email (search for "Gazebo style guide") and eventually became @spaepcke 's [style guide](https://drive.google.com/a/osrfoundation.org/uc?id=0B_0d9M9XDFBVa2RiMnJFYnRVWUk&export=download).

The long term goal is to eventually support some / all of the [material design color palettes](https://material.io/guidelines/style/color.html#color-color-palette) within Ignition GUI, so 3rd party applications can easily choose among these colors if they want to. We could choose one of those more standard colors for now, and move the orange to `gazebo_experimental` so Ignition GUI is more neutral. (3rd party applications can override the style, see pull request #17). I see the red introduced in this PR follows the red palette, so we could start with that. I just wanted to make sure what was the general motivation for the pull request.
content.html:
I was using orange because that was decided over a year ago in an internal email (search for "Gazebo style guide") and eventually became @spaepcke 's style guide.

The long term goal is to eventually support some / all of the material design color palettes within Ignition GUI, so 3rd party applications can easily choose among these colors if they want to. We could choose one of those more standard colors for now, and move the orange to gazebo_experimental so Ignition GUI is more neutral. (3rd party applications can override the style, see pull request #17). I see the red introduced in this PR follows the red palette, so we could start with that. I just wanted to make sure what was the general motivation for the pull request.

content.raw: Any particular reason red was chosen? Changing the color is fine, it's just important to keep track of how many different colors start getting introduced. I suggest picking no more than 3 or 4 colors (from Material Design, to make it easier) that go together nicely, and make sure that those are the only colors used. If too many are introduced, the UI will start looking inconsistent.
content.html: Any particular reason red was chosen? Changing the color is fine, it's just important to keep track of how many different colors start getting introduced. I suggest picking no more than 3 or 4 colors (from Material Design, to make it easier) that go together nicely, and make sure that those are the only colors used. If too many are introduced, the UI will start looking inconsistent.

content.raw:
Thanks for the PR, @caguero and for the insight, @thesteffinator ! 

Pull request #24 adds some extra functionality to loading custom stylesheets, and as mentioned there, I'm pursuing other leads on how to more easily offer various material design palettes that can be used by downstream projects.
content.html:
Thanks for the PR, @caguero and for the insight, @thesteffinator !

Pull request #24 adds some extra functionality to loading custom stylesheets, and as mentioned there, I'm pursuing other leads on how to more easily offer various material design palettes that can be used by downstream projects.
